result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle A Boho was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 89 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $3415.00 to be paid to Thomas F. as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent.  Sign all release for Agent.

No contact with John Shelton, co-actor or victim listed in criminal complaint.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AMENDED 1/3/2017:  COURT MODIFIES THE JOC TO ALLOW FOR CONTACT WITH JOHN S.S. ON OUR FAMILY WIZARD, ONLY FOR PURPOSES OF CHILD CUSTODY, PLACEMENT AND SUPPORT ISSUES.

records.addlTxt:
signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow 10/07/2020.

LF 10/8--transmitted electronically via DOC interface; mailed copy to defendant.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/05/2020--Denied. Defendant has a well documented history of violating her rules of supervision. Defendant has also gone through the Earned Release Program. Reduction would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense and is not in the interests of justice.**

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michelle A Boho in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1 with the repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Smith makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1. 
Imposed Sentence of:
5  Years Imprisonment Consecutive to any other sentence (Credit - 89 days)
2 Years of Initial Confinement
3 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with John Shelton Co-actor or victim listed in criminal complaint.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent. 
Sign All Release for Agent;
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.
Restitution: $3415.00 to be paid to Thomas F. as a condition of extended supervision
COSTS:  $268.00  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury status hearing at 01-28-2016 09:30 am
Jury trial - 12 person at 02-02-2016 08:30 am

CASHBAIL LOWERED TO $5,000.00  CONDITIONS MODIFIED:  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim, not to be within 1 block radius  of the victims home listed in the complaint.   Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms. To be monitored by WCS. No use or possession of illegal controlled substances. Must report all prescriptions to WCS.  Must submit to any test per WCS to check for illegal controlled substances or alcohol.  No alcohol use.
